decks.notes: The deck focuses on leveraging a combination of powerful reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring back high-impact creatures such as Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The goal is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, allowing for explosive plays to overwhelm the opponent. Alongside disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own powerful combos for a swift victory.

This deck focuses on using powerful red cards and disruptive artifacts to quickly lock down the opponent's resources and overwhelm them with a quick and aggressive strategy. By utilizing cards like Blood Moon, Magus of the Moon, Chalice of the Void, and Ancient Tomb, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and come out ahead in the early game. The inclusion of powerful dragons like Fury and Pyrogoyf, as well as cards like Broadside Bombardiers and Sundering Eruption, allows the deck to finish off the opponent quickly once they have been disrupted.

This deck revolves around assembling the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill out the opponent's library. The deck includes various artifact cards to support the combo, along with cards like Urza's Bauble and Mishra's Bauble for card advantage and graveyard recursion. Emry, Lurker of the Loch helps to recur artifacts from the graveyard, while Pinnacle Emissary and Kappa Cannoneer provide additional utility. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Force of Will and Lavaspur Boots, making it a versatile and powerful combo deck in the Legacy format.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions and resources using counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through card draw engines like Narset, Parter of Veils and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The inclusion of cards like Back to Basics and Containment Priest also shows a focus on disrupting specific strategies, such as nonbasic lands and graveyard strategies. The deck looks to outvalue the opponent over the course of the game and ultimately win through attrition.

This deck aims to quickly combo off by using Cephalid Illusionist along with Nomads en-Kor to mill cards into the graveyard. Once enough cards are in the graveyard, Dread Return can be used to bring Thassa's Oracle into play, winning the game by drawing a card. The deck also includes protection in the form of Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, as well as card selection through cards like Brainstorm and Ponder. The deck utilizes the synergy between Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to execute a fast and efficient combo win condition.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and counterspells. It aims to control the game through efficient card draw and card advantage, while also utilizing graveyard interaction to gain an advantage. By carefully managing resources and making strategic plays, the deck seeks to outmaneuver the opponent and establish a dominant position on the battlefield. The deck's key strategy lies in its ability to make calculated decisions and adapt to different threats, ultimately leading to victory through superior card advantage and control.

The deck focuses on using graveyard manipulation and quick mana generation to reanimate powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Archon of Cruelty, in order to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes disruption and card draw spells to protect the combo and find the necessary pieces. It aims to win through powerful creature attacks and disruptive plays, utilizing a mix of threats and control elements to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a combination of powerful reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring back powerful creatures from the graveyard, such as Murktide Regent and Archon of Cruelty. The deck also includes a strong suite of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo. Additionally, there are card draw spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency and find the necessary combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to quickly set up a powerful board presence and outpace the opponent before they can react effectively.

The deck revolves around quickly casting a large number of spells to combo off and win the game in one turn. By using cards like Dark Ritual, Simian Spirit Guide, and Lotus Petal for fast mana, the deck aims to play out its entire library by sacrificing creatures like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to fill the graveyard with creatures and win conditions. With cards like Pact of Negation and Duress to protect the combo, the deck ultimately aims to win the game by playing Thassa's Oracle and revealing no remaining cards in the library.

The deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo using cards like Crop Rotation, Green Sun's Zenith, and Sylvan Library to quickly find the necessary pieces. It includes protection and disruption in the form of Swords to Plowshares, Mox Diamond, and Endurance to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also utilizes utility lands like Bojuka Bog, Karakas, and Maze of Ith to further its game plan. Overall, the key strategy is to efficiently assemble the Dark Depths combo while controlling the game and disrupting the opponent's plans.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the Painter's Servant and Grindstone combo to mill the opponent's library, while utilizing artifacts like Grim Monolith, Mox Opal and Voltaic Key to generate mana quickly. Karn, the Great Creator and Tezzeret, Cruel Captain provide additional support and control over the board, making it difficult for the opponent to disrupt the combo. By utilizing powerful artifacts and mana sources like Urza's Workshop and Urza's Tower, this deck aims to quickly and efficiently execute its game plan to achieve victory.

This Legacy 1 vs 1 deck focuses on assembling the Painter combo using cards like Grindstone and Painter's Servant to mill the opponent's deck. It also includes additional support cards like Goblin Engineer and Goblin Welder to find and recur combo pieces, along with disruption spells like Pyroblast and Red Elemental Blast. The deck utilizes mana acceleration from cards like Ancient Tomb and Simian Spirit Guide to quickly establish its combo while also incorporating artifact hate and protection with cards like Ensnaring Bridge and Karn, the Great Creator.

This deck focuses on aggressively using creatures with powerful abilities and cheap removal spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. It aims to apply pressure early and maintain it throughout the game, leveraging cards like Goblin Bombardment and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah to deal damage and control the opponent's resources. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the strategy revolves around aggressive creature-based tactics combined with disruption to control the pace of the game and secure victory.

The deck focuses on using combo pieces like Nomads en-Kor and Nadu, Winged Wisdom to generate infinite mana and draw your entire deck, eventually winning the game with a Craterhoof Behemoth or other big creature. The deck utilizes efficient mana dorks like Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch to ramp quickly into key combo pieces, while also incorporating protection cards like Sylvan Safekeeper and Endurance to protect your combo. The deck also includes tutor spells like Green Sun's Zenith and Chord of Calling to search for key combo pieces when needed.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with powerful creatures through cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bring them back onto the battlefield for a quick win. The deck also includes various counterspells and disruption to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent provides additional threats and versatility. Additionally, cards like Thoughtseize and Wasteland help to control the opponent's hand and mana base. Overall, this deck aims to quickly and efficiently reanimate powerful creatures to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly getting out powerful cards such as Karn, the Great Creator, Omniscience, and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn by using the card Show and Tell to put them directly into play. The deck also utilizes cards like Lotus Petal and Force of Will to help set up combos and protect key pieces. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Sink into Stupor and Lórien Revealed provide disruption for opponent's strategies. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and abilities while controlling the game tempo.
